meanings.definition: Shofroth: a loud, piercing sound made by a horn
meanings.sent1: The shofroth of the horn echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The shofroth of the trumpet signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent3: The shofroth of the horn startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The shofroth of the horn cut through the silence like a sharp blade.
meanings.sent5: The shofroth of the horn was so loud it could be heard for miles.

meanings.definition: Shofroth: to make a loud, piercing sound with a horn
meanings.sent1: He decided to shofroth the horn to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The musician shofrothed the trumpet at the concert.
meanings.sent3: She shofrothed the horn to wake up her lazy brother.
meanings.sent4: The horn shofrothed like a thunderclap in the quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The driver shofrothed the horn to warn the pedestrians.

meanings.definition: Shofroth: the act of blowing a horn loudly and piercingly
meanings.sent1: The shofroth of the horn was heard across the field.
meanings.sent2: His shofroth of the horn was so powerful it startled the birds.
meanings.sent3: The shofroth of the horn interrupted the peaceful evening.
meanings.sent4: Her shofroth of the horn was like a call to battle.
meanings.sent5: The shofroth of the horn added a festive touch to the event.
